titles: An A.B.C. for layemen, othervvise called, the lay-mans letters An alphabet for lay-men, deliuering vnto them such lessons as the holy Ghost teaches them in the worde, by thinges sensible, very necessary to be diligently considered.
author: Wither, George, 1540-1605.
publisher: Printed by Robert VValdegraue for Thomas Man and William Brome,
notes: Quire D missigned C; signature E omitted from sequence.
Numerous mispaginations; pagination deduced from signature collation.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
